      public com.squareup.okhttp.Call deleteFormMessageByIdCall​(java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, java.lang.String id, ProgressResponseBody.ProgressListener progressListener, ProgressRequestBody.ProgressRequestListener progressRequestListener) throws ApiException
      Build call for deleteFormMessageById
      Parameters:
      evApiKey - API Key required to make the API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access token required to make the API call. (required)
      id - ID of the entry to be deleted data for (required)
      progressListener - Progress listener
      progressRequestListener - Progress request listener
      Returns:
      Call to execute
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to serialize the request body object

    • deleteFormMessageById

      public EmptyResponse deleteFormMessageById​(java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, java.lang.String id) throws ApiException
      Delete a receive form submission Deletes a form submission entry, which represents one time that a visitor filled out the form and uploaded files. This deletes only the record of the submission (the date, the values entered in the form and the names of the files uploaded by the visitor).The share and any associated file resources will not be deleted by this. **Notes**: - Use the [GET /form/entries/{formId}](#operation/getFormMessageById) to list the submissions and obtain the ID of the entry you want to delete - You must have the [DeleteFormData permission](/docs/account/04-users/00-introduction#managing-user-roles-and-permissions) in order to use this operation - It is not possible to un-delete data that is removed in this way
      Parameters:
      evApiKey - API Key required to make the API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access token required to make the API call. (required)
      id - ID of the entry to be deleted data for (required)
      Returns:
      EmptyResponse
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body

    • deleteFormMessageByIdWithHttpInfo

      public ApiResponse<EmptyResponse> deleteFormMessageByIdWithHttpInfo​(java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, java.lang.String id) throws ApiException
      Delete a receive form submission Deletes a form submission entry, which represents one time that a visitor filled out the form and uploaded files. This deletes only the record of the submission (the date, the values entered in the form and the names of the files uploaded by the visitor).The share and any associated file resources will not be deleted by this. **Notes**: - Use the [GET /form/entries/{formId}](#operation/getFormMessageById) to list the submissions and obtain the ID of the entry you want to delete - You must have the [DeleteFormData permission](/docs/account/04-users/00-introduction#managing-user-roles-and-permissions) in order to use this operation - It is not possible to un-delete data that is removed in this way
      Parameters:
      evApiKey - API Key required to make the API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access token required to make the API call. (required)
      id - ID of the entry to be deleted data for (required)
      Returns:
      ApiResponse<EmptyResponse>
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body

    • deleteFormMessageByIdAsync

      public com.squareup.okhttp.Call deleteFormMessageByIdAsync​(java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, java.lang.String id, ApiCallback<EmptyResponse> callback) throws ApiException
      Delete a receive form submission (asynchronously) Deletes a form submission entry, which represents one time that a visitor filled out the form and uploaded files. This deletes only the record of the submission (the date, the values entered in the form and the names of the files uploaded by the visitor).The share and any associated file resources will not be deleted by this. **Notes**: - Use the [GET /form/entries/{formId}](#operation/getFormMessageById) to list the submissions and obtain the ID of the entry you want to delete - You must have the [DeleteFormData permission](/docs/account/04-users/00-introduction#managing-user-roles-and-permissions) in order to use this operation - It is not possible to un-delete data that is removed in this way
      Parameters:
      evApiKey - API Key required to make the API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access token required to make the API call. (required)
      id - ID of the entry to be deleted data for (required)
      callback - The callback to be executed when the API call finishes
      Returns:
      The request call
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to process the API call, e.g. serializing the request body object

      public com.squareup.okhttp.Call getFormByIdCall​(java.lang.Integer id, java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, java.lang.String include, ProgressResponseBody.ProgressListener progressListener, ProgressRequestBody.ProgressRequestListener progressRequestListener) throws ApiException
      Build call for getFormById
      Parameters:
      id - Form unique ID number. (required)
      evApiKey - API key required to make the API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access Token required to make the API call. (required)
      include - Enter \"**share**\" to get information about associated receive folder. (optional)
      progressListener - Progress listener
      progressRequestListener - Progress request listener
      Returns:
      Call to execute
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to serialize the request body object

    • getFormById

      public FormResponse getFormById​(java.lang.Integer id, java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, java.lang.String include) throws ApiException
      Get receive folder form by Id Returns the [file upload form](/docs/account/05-file-sharing/05-form-builder) assigned to a [receive folder](/docs/account/05-file-sharing/04-receive-folders). The form details will return all the input fields and their settings. Use the `include` parameter (with the value **share**) to also retrieve the details of the associated receive folder. **Note** If you prefer to find a form by its shareHash, you can use the [GET /forms](#operation/getFormByShareHash) endpoint instead.
      Parameters:
      id - Form unique ID number. (required)
      evApiKey - API key required to make the API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access Token required to make the API call. (required)
      include - Enter \"**share**\" to get information about associated receive folder. (optional)
      Returns:
      FormResponse
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body

    • getFormByShareHashCall

      public com.squareup.okhttp.Call getFormByShareHashCall​(java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, java.lang.String shareHash, java.lang.String include, ProgressResponseBody.ProgressListener progressListener, ProgressRequestBody.ProgressRequestListener progressRequestListener) throws ApiException

      Parameters:
      evApiKey - API key required to make the API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access Token required to make the API call. (required)
      shareHash - Share hash to retrieve the form for. (required)
      include - Related record types to include in the response. Valid option is **share** (optional)
      progressListener - Progress listener
      progressRequestListener - Progress request listener
      Returns:
      Call to execute
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to serialize the request body object

    • getFormByShareHash

      public FormResponse getFormByShareHash​(java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, java.lang.String shareHash, java.lang.String include) throws ApiException
      Get receive folder form settings Get the information for the [file upload form](/docs/account/05-file-sharing/05-form-builder) assigned to a [receive folder](/docs/account/05-file-sharing/04-receive-folders) by its shareHash. The form details will return all the input field settings and the CSS for the form. Use the `include` parameter (with the value **share**) to also get the details of the associated receive folder. **Note** - If you prefer to find a form by its ID, you can use the [GET /forms/{id}](#operation/getFormById) endpoint instead.
      Parameters:
      evApiKey - API key required to make the API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access Token required to make the API call. (required)
      shareHash - Share hash to retrieve the form for. (required)
      include - Related record types to include in the response. Valid option is **share** (optional)
      Returns:
      FormResponse
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body

    • getFormByShareHashWithHttpInfo

      public ApiResponse<FormResponse> getFormByShareHashWithHttpInfo​(java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, java.lang.String shareHash, java.lang.String include) throws ApiException
      Get receive folder form settings Get the information for the [file upload form](/docs/account/05-file-sharing/05-form-builder) assigned to a [receive folder](/docs/account/05-file-sharing/04-receive-folders) by its shareHash. The form details will return all the input field settings and the CSS for the form. Use the `include` parameter (with the value **share**) to also get the details of the associated receive folder. **Note** - If you prefer to find a form by its ID, you can use the [GET /forms/{id}](#operation/getFormById) endpoint instead.
      Parameters:
      evApiKey - API key required to make the API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access Token required to make the API call. (required)
      shareHash - Share hash to retrieve the form for. (required)
      include - Related record types to include in the response. Valid option is **share** (optional)
      Returns:
      ApiResponse<FormResponse>
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body

      Get receive folder form settings (asynchronously) Get the information for the [file upload form](/docs/account/05-file-sharing/05-form-builder) assigned to a [receive folder](/docs/account/05-file-sharing/04-receive-folders) by its shareHash. Use the `include` parameter (with the value **share**) to also get the details of the associated receive folder. **Note** - If you prefer to find a form by its ID, you can use the [GET /forms/{id}](#operation/getFormById) endpoint instead.

    • getFormEntries

      public FormEntryResponse getFormEntries​(java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, java.lang.String id, java.lang.Integer limit, java.lang.Integer offset) throws ApiException
      Get form data entries for a receive Returns the form data entries for a specific form for a receive. Optional parameters can be included in the call to manage larger data sets.
      Parameters:
      evApiKey - API Key required to make the API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access token required to make the API call. (required)
      id - ID of the form to retrieve entries for. (required)
      limit - Limit of records to be returned (for pagination) (optional)
      offset - Current offset of records (for pagination) (optional)
      Returns:
      FormEntryResponse
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body

    • updateFormById

      public FormResponse updateFormById​(java.lang.String evApiKey, java.lang.String evAccessToken, java.lang.Integer id, Body2 body) throws ApiException
      Updates a form with given parameters Add, update, or delete a form's parameters. This will alter how your users/customers will see and interact with the form when sending you files. **Notes** *This call will **replace** your current form in its entirety.* If you want to keep any existing elements unchanged, be sure to submit the call with an element's current settings to preserve them.
      Parameters:
      evApiKey - API Key required to make the API call. (required)
      evAccessToken - Access token required to make the API call. (required)
      id - Form unique ID number. (required)
      body - (optional)
      Returns:
      FormResponse
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body
